title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-5.2 - Additional financial aid
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-5.2 - Additional financial aid

State Regulations

To qualify as additional financial aid for the purposes
of subdivision 5 of Education Law, section 6405, financial aid accorded to
students by the institution shall be derived from funds, other than government
funds, made available for student aid purposes, and shall be in excess of the
amount of such funds devoted by the institution to student aid purposes in the
1980-81 academic year. Such funds may include scholarship and other direct
grants, tuition and fee waivers, tuition and fee remissions, tuition and fee
exemptions, wages paid for employment or assistantships, student loans, room
and board waivers, and any other direct support of needy
students. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
145-5.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
